profileText: A Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Pittsburgh, Pa., May 11, 1786; instructed by his father and private tutors; attended a French academy at St. Genevieve, La.; studied law; was admitted to the bar in 1806 and practiced in Somerset, Pa., until 1810; appointed deputy attorney general of the Territory of Orleans (Louisiana) in 1811; district judge of Louisiana in 1812; appointed secretary of a mission to South America in 1817; judge for the western district of Florida 1821-1832; returned to Pennsylvania in 1832 and became owner of a large tract of land upon which he founded the town of Tarentum, Pa.; elected as a Whig to the Twenty-sixth Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of Richard Biddle and served from October 13, 1840, to March 3, 1841; unsuccessful candidate for renomination in 1840; member of the commission under the treaty with Mexico in 1841; engaged in literary pursuits until his death in Pittsburgh, Pa., January 18, 1871; interment in Prospect Cemetery, Brackenridge, Pa.

note.content: Elected to fill vacancy caused by resignation of Richard Biddle, and took his seat December 10, 1840.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Brackenridge, Henry Marie. Early discoveries by Spaniards in New Mexico. Pittsburgh: H. Miner 7 Co., 1857.
------. A eulogy, on the lives and characters of John Adams & Thomas Jefferson. Pensacola, Fla.: W. H. Hunt, 1826.

------. History of the late war between the United States and Great Britain: comprising a minute account of the various military and naval operations. Philadelphia: J. Kay, jun. and brother; Pittsburgh: C. H. Kay & Co., 1844. Reprint, Notable American Authors Series - Part I). Reprint Services Corporation, n.d.
------. History of the western insurrection in western Pennsylvania, commonly called the Whiskey Insurrection, 1794. Pittsburgh: Printed by W. S. Haven, 1859.
------. Journal of a voyage up the river Missouri; performed in eighteen hundred and eleven. 2d ed. Baltimore: Pub. by Coale and Maxwell, Pomeroy & Toy, printers, 1815.
------. Recollections of Persons & Places in the West. Reprint Services Corporation, Reprint edition, 1989.

------. South America; a letter on the present state of that country to James Monroe. Washington: Printed and published, at the office of the National Register.....October 15, 1817. Reprint, Notable American Authors Series - Part I. Reprint Services Corporation, n.d.
------. Views of Louisiana. Chicago, Quadrangle Books [1962]. Reprint, Notable American Authors Series - Part I. Reprint Services Corp, n.d.
------. Voyage to Buenos Ayres, performed in the years 1817 and 1818, by order of the American government. London: Sir R. Phillips and Co., 1820.
------. Voyage to South America, performed by order of the American government in the years 1817 and 1818, in the frigate Congress. London: Printed for J. Miller, 1820.
Keller, William F. The Nation's Advocate: Henry Marie Brackenridge and Young America. Pittsburgh: University of Pittsburgh Press, 1956.

researchRecord.name: 1814, 1822-1845. 1 box and 1 item.
researchRecord.description: Photocopies of material once loaned to the society and transcript of a letter in the Shaler collection of the Historical Society of Pennsylvania. Mainly personal correspondence, some speeches, and account of a journey to Florida.

researchRecord.name: 1816-1870. 195 items and 1 volume.
researchRecord.description: Correspondence, political essays, and documents. Unpublished index to letter book and calendar of other papers in library. Restricted.
